revised_title: Determination of the Mechanical Equivalent of Heat in Terms of International Electrical Units
tldr: The authors experimentally determine the heat capacity of water and the mechanical equivalent of heat using the continuous-flow method of calorimetry. They find that the mean mechanical equivalent of heat is 4.37 Joules per calorie, with a thermal capacity of water varying between 1.00 and 1.42 calories per gram between freezing and boiling points.
